title: Information Security Intern
desc: I've assisted in maintaining vulnerability management and building automation for the Global Cybersecurity Services team at Starbucks. I am using Python, Redis, and Docker to stand up concurrent programming and APIs. At Starbucks, I have experience deploying applications in Azure and building CI/CD pipelines to assist in our deployments.

title: BS in Computer Science
desc: I graduated from ASU summa cum laude with a 3.96 GPA. I was member of The Software Developer’s Association. During my time as an undergrad, I was a teaching assistant for object-oriented programming and data structures in Java. I held office hours, review sessions, and served as a bridge between the students and the professor. I am a member of the NSF funded Academic Success and Professional Development Scholarship program. I am now pursuing a master’s degree in Computer Science at ASU.

title: Software Engineering Intern
desc: As an intern on the payment acceptance team at Walmart, I built internal application to empower quality engineers and business partners to make development changes and production commits respectively to the attributes associated to issuer/bank identification numbers that Walmart supports. This application used a REST API and was built using React.js.

title: Engineering Instructor
desc: At Play-Well Teknologies, I taught students grades K-2 and 6-8 principles in Engineering, Science and Technology through hands-on project-based learning with LEGO in class sizes of  typically 15 students. My time as an Engineering Instructor taught me great leadership and how to teach and work with others.
